text: # interestingbackstory famous novelist Ernest Hemingway met George Orwell early in his career when they both volunteered for the Republic of Spain in the Spanish Civil War they would respectively write For Whom the Bells Toll and Homage to Catalonia the latter being less succesful

Catalonia Spain: Freedom-Peace-Democracy Interested in Spanish history? Homage to Catalonia: Personal account of George Orwell's experiences in the Spanish Civil War For Whom the Bell Tolls: Ernest Hemingway's descriptions of war/strife, mustache styling & Spanish swear words https://twitter.com/thetimes/status/931948225682202625 …

Spanish Civil War George Orwell: Homage to Catalonia Orwell cared about working people & was called to Catalonia's socialists against Franco's Fascists Ernest Hemingway: For Whom the Bell Tolls Hemingway was on the republican side but shows the good & the bad of both sides
